result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Carey Haynes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2016CM30 Count 1

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
AMENDED 07-31-2017:  Following Probation Review Hearing, Court ordered defendant serve 14 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 09-15-2017 unless by that date all court ordered obligations are paid in full as verified by Department of Corrections.
AMENDED 09-11-2017:  Received verification from DOC that defendant paid obligations in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Carey Haynes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documentation from DOC that defendant paid outstanding obligations in full.
Routed to Judge.  Judge responded to put a 10 day hold on it.
State's Motion to Amend Birth Date

Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court.  Probation Agent Krisik appears in court.  Probation Hrg. for unpaid court ordered obligations.  Court informs defendant could extend probation or alternative further jail.  Court modifies probation and order 14 days jail com. 9/15/17 at 6:00 p.m. unless by that date all court ordered obligations are paid in full.
Probation review hearing on July 31, 2017 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution of cases:  16CM30 plea to count 1, dismiss count 2; plea to D.C. charge in 16CM24, dismiss 16CM23.  Court advises defendant of charge in 16CM24/max penalties; advised of count 1 in 16CM30/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to D.C. and Bail Jumping.  Court dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM30 and dismiss 16CM23.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 yr. probation with conditions; advised of appeal rights.
Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Prior: 805 3rd Avenue East #19, Durand, WI 54736

Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reminds defendant of Signature Bond in the earlier cases.  State addressed bond.  Defendant informs he intends to move.  Court sets bond in new case.   NGP entered on all cases.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement.  Need to notify victims.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
No contact with L.H. and D.S.

Defendant Richard Carey Haynes in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  District Attorney states charges/max. penalties.  Court advised defendant of rights. State requests $500 Signature Bond with conditions: no contact with L.H. and D.S.; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court informed he was in alcohol withdrawal and concerned if true.  Court inquires if defendant would like to be referred to Human Services "yes sir".  Court will not include no drink but will include the no contact provisions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
